name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.

meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow

sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.

Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.

meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness

The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.

meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.

meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.

meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.

Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.

The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.

name: Rain on someone's parade

meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit

name: Slink off

name: Shoehorn

name: Rain on someone's parade

meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required

name: Bustling around

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness

sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.

sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.
As I flip the page and squirrel away all of my memories and experiences, I'd like to wish everyone a happy new year!

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy
sentences: The team's star player was injured and it really took the wind out of their sails.
I got into an accident 4 years ago and it took the wind out of my sails.

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure
sentences: I don't mean to rain on your parade but I have some bad news.

name: Liquify into puddle on the floor
meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.
My mom breaks the charged silence by asking him about his favorite food item.
We stare across the desk at each other in charged silence.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required
sentences: Should I cough up the 200$ or can I have my cake and eat it too?
He coughed up the monthly subscription fee to continue with the service.

name: Bustling around
meaning: To move in a hurried way because often the person is busy
sentences: Bustling around the kitchen.
Because her relatives are coming to visit, Annabelle is bustling around the house cleaning the whole house.

name: Painstaking
meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
sentences: Painstaking attention to detail.
It took months of painstaking work to land this job.
Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

name: Stooge
meaning: A person who serves merely to support or assist others
sentences: He seems more like a stooge than a master criminal.
I always wanted to be perfect at something. I just never thought that I'd be the perfect stooge.

name: Falacious
meaning: Based on mistaken belief
sentences: Your characterization of the situation as typical is falacious.
Fallacious arguments.
Fallacious ideas shouldn't be allowed to spread unchecked.

name: Above board
meaning: legitimate, honest and open
sentences: We felt the judging was all above board and honest.
Let's play 20 questions. I promise to be above board with you.
The accountants acted completely above board.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
sentences: flamboyant display of arobatics.
I'm wearing flamboyant footwear, usually with some type of embelishment.
I like to wear my flamboyant blazer with scissors lapel pins. It always makes for great conversations.
A flamboyant performer.

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way
We cannot have a rational dispassionate discourse here if you are gonna throw the topline figure and pearl at clutches every time.

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.
The mental image of this muscle-bound behemoth hunched over a calculator is so incongruent.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.
I'll inject more fluids into his IV and try to nip it in the bud.
The policy regarding making some damming changes to the status of F-1 visa students has been nipped in the bud without reaching Trump's ears.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.
The dry years had cracked and fissured the cliffs.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.
Ben gave him a very intimidating look and snarled at him, and he slinked off.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Flamboyant
meaning: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness

name: Dispassionate
meaning: Not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
sentences: She dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way

name: Behemoth
meaning: A huge or monstrous creature, something enormous
sentences: Behemoths like the Bronstosaurus.

name: Aberrant
meaning: Departing from an accepted standard
sentences: This somewhat aberrant behavior requires an explanation.
We're not compromising our study for an aberrant case.

name: Out of Place
meaning: In a setting where one is or feels inappropriate or incongruous
sentences: The glamorous woman seemed radically out of place in the launderette.
This hotel is so out of my place.
Clubs are kind of out of place.

name: Nip It in the Bud
meaning: Suppress or destroy something at an early stage
sentences: The idea has been nipped in the bud at the local level.

name: Fissure
meaning: A long, narrow opening or line of breakage made by cracking or splitting, especially in rock or earth
sentences: I dropped the Noah's ark in the fissure upstate that opened up as a result of high seismic activities caused due to our testing.

name: Flip Someone's Lid
meaning: to become crazy or very angry
sentences: His mother would flip her lid if she saw what a mess he'd made.
Some people will flip their lids no matter what the metrics are.

name: Rap Sheet
meaning: A criminal Record
sentences: He had not joined a gang or acquired a rap sheet.
How did my buttoned up brother rack up a rap sheet like this, I don't get it!

name: Wild Goose Chase
meaning: A foolish and hopeless pursuit of something unattainable
sentences: Physicists searching for the hypothetical particle may be on a wild goose chase.
Public health officials waiting for COVID to be eliminated to drop the restrictions are honestly on a wild goose chase.

name: Slick
meaning: Smooth or superficially impressive but insincere or shallow
sentences: The brands are backed by slick advertising.
Peter Doocey's comebacks are slicker.

name: Dredge
meaning: Clean out the bed of (a river, harbor or other area of water) by scooping out mud, weeds and rubbish with a dredge
sentences: The lower stretch of the river has been dredged.
They dredged the tailfin out of the ocean.

name: Going rogue
meaning: Behaving erratically or dangerously, especially by disregarding the rules or usual way of doing things
sentences: Now is not the time to go rogue.
Leaders going rogue at press conferences can mean you have a serious problem.

name: Run interference
meaning: Intervene on behalf of someone, typically so as to protect them from annoyance or distraction
sentences: Elizabeth was quick to run interference and said that the professor would be very busy.
I need you to run interference.

name: Bury the Hatchet
meaning: End a quarrel or conflict and become friendly
sentences: After months of not talking to each other, me and Hannah finally burried the hatchet.
If I were you, I'd bury the hatchet.
The two countries decided to finally bury the hatchet.

name: Clandestine
meaning: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because illicit
sentences: She deserved better than these clandestine meetings.
This dim litted bar seems like the place where all these clandestine activities would go down.

name: Slink off
meaning: Depart furtively
sentences: The shoplifter slipped an item into his coat and slunk away.
After that scolding, she slunk away.

name: Shoehorn
meaning: force into an inadequate space
sentences: People were shoehorned into cramped corners.

name: Strained
meaning: Force (a part of one's body or oneself) to make a strenuous or unusually great effort
sentences: I stopped and listened, straining my ears for any sound.

name: Squirrel away
meaning: To put something in a safe or secret place especially so that it can be kept for future use
sentences: Most of his money is squirelled away somewhere.

name: Take the wind out of someone's sails
meaning: To cause someone to lose confidence or energy

name: Rain on someone's parade
meaning: To spoil someone's pleasure

meaning: Feel overwhelmed due to a strong, often nice, emotion
sentences: His velvety chocolate sex voice nearly liquifies me into a puddle on the floor.

name: Charged
meaning: Filled with excitement, tension or emotion
sentences: The highly charged atmosphere created by the boycott.

name: Cough Up
meaning: Give something reluctantly, especially money or other information that is due or required

meaning: Done with or employing great care or thoroughness
